dialogues.text: Gesundheit, buddy. Benjamin demonstrates the same behavior. For a moment, it like two mimes showing off their moves. Buster looks entertained by Benjamin. He’s comforted. Benjamin feels deeply connected...

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN -
dialogues.text: As Buster inches into frame, we truly grasp the explosive power and size of the animal.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: (nearby shouting) Confirmation! He broke the latch on the enclosure!! Buster ROARS loudly.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I understand. I feel that way most of the time. We are now on the hair-trigger precipice of real violence This is not a “fun” bear. This is the real thing. And dee inside, Benjamin feels like this may be the end. BENJAMIN (CONT’D) I don’t care about me. But you’1l make my kids sad. Buster looks at him understandingly, and what looks to us like a depth of feeling. BENJAMIN (CONT’D) Well... one of them for sure. Something passes between them. And then...

dialogues.speaker: BAM BAM. BAM.
dialogues.text: Buster gets a dazed look and crumples to the ground. The others swarm closer, and all are suddenly on cell-pho We can hear the chatter.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN KELLY
dialogues.text: Benjamin was doing some hypno- Benjamin contained him. He voodoo stuff on him —- okay.  58. Benjamin shrugs it off. He’s still in shock, really. He looks down at the tranquilized bear who was, just moments earlier, communicating deeply with him.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIS
dialogues.text: He was toying with you, my boy. That’s what they do before you become chips and salsa.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: No, I think we were dancing.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIS
dialogues.text: The last dance. Benjamin ain’t buying it. He turns to Ellis with a though

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: i saw him on the hillside. Utterly Yee...

dialogues.speaker: ELLIS
dialogues.text: You're lucky.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Ellis. I want to make his enclosure bigger. He exits. &llis turns to Rosie and Dylan.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIS
dialogues.text: Your Dad just faced down a 750 pound North-American Grizzly Bear.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: (wide-eyed) I was supposed to stay in my room. Dylan looks across, to Lily. Lily has begun to dress more darkly, and wear make-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly, Robin and Benjamin secure the completely unconscio Buster into his enclosure. Dylan and Rosie watch from a s distance. The SAN DIEGO VET officiously withdraws a leath case. With much fanfare, he withdraws a “field” credit ca machine. And presents Benjamin with a bill.

dialogues.speaker: VET
dialogues.text: I take Visa. I prefer Mastercard. Benjamin is still staring at the bill. The Vet puts a reassuring hand on his shoulder.  59.

dialogues.speaker: VET, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey. Nobody died. Benjamin looks at him -- good point -- and slowly withdra his Zoo credit card. The Vet snatches it with an elaborat flourish, runs in through the machine, gets the signature and leaves Benjamin with a receipt, all in a swirl of pom He tucks the card machine into the leather case. It is hi ritual. The Vet exits. Benjamin feels drained, in almost every way. He mumbles: “The World’s Most Expensive Vet...

dialogues.speaker: ELLIS
dialogues.text: If you're serious about extending the enclosure, I can start tomorrow. Benjamin lets out a quiet whistle.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Why not. He has no idea where the money will come from. Ellis exit leaving Benjamin alone with Kelly. Kelly is impressed.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: You’re getting a... She makes the “lifting” gesture.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: +» handle on it.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE JAGUAR COFFIN
dialogues.text: Ferris’ face back on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin is a hero. Ellis, already pleasantly high on Scotch, salutes him while playing darts. Ferris’ face has returned to the dartboard too. Camaraderie grows. Benjami gains strength from his growing family. Dylan watches, feeling excluded. Lily notices. She gestures to him. Benjamin notices them exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily and Dylan sit on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: I love that you were named after Bob Dylan. She looks at him, so impressed by him. He's not used to t kind of attention.  60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deep blue night. Just the lights on from the Jaguar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin and Kelly walk to her truck. Both have had a bee or two. She reaches into her pocket for her keys, as they crunch across the gravel parking lot. Walking silently.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I’m worried that Lily ie going to hurt Dylan.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Oh no. It’s going to be the other way around.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: How do you figure that? She‘s a farm girl, Ben... jamin. He’s like this exotic creature from the city.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: My son? Exotic?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I was worried you thought he was a little bit of a jerk.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: I'm guessing that Rosie was more like your wife, and Dylan is more like you. That’s why you're so hard on him, right? He laughs ruefully. It’s starting to rain, and this conversation has grown too personal.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I want you to know. TI think you’re pretty. Please don’t be offended if I don’t hit on you.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: I’d be offended if you did.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Good.  61. big £. a I'm a big fan of people being exactly who they are.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: We think alike.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: We do.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: If © wanted to be kissed by you, you wouldn’t have a choice.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: (polite, pleasantly buzzed) I have no doubt...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: See you.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: See you. They exit in opposite directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin stands on the porch, looking out at the zoo. INT. DYLAN’S ROOM -- NIGHT Dylan lies in bed, thinking about Lily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin peels off his wet clothes. Throws them on top of the giant pile of laundry overflowing a basket in the cor He pulls on a pair of sweats. He pulls open a dresser dra -- not much in there that’s clean. A beat, then Benjamin finds something. The old USD sweatshirt. He laughs, still a little woozy from the day the beer. He pulls it on. Then promptly goes over to the bed and tosses himself across it, exhausted. He shoves hi hands into his pockets. And then... He withdraws something. A piece of paper. He looks at it carefully. He is instantly sober.  62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda the Secretary has gathered the Staff together.

dialogues.speaker: RHONDA
dialogues.text: I've been checking his bills. People, I hate to tell you this. The Zoo Account is empty. He has no more money. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: RHONDA
dialogues.text: He‘s going to end up selling this place to somebody cheap, for the land alone. I‘m warning you now. Behind that front... is a front. He’s a fraud! INT. DUNCAN’S ACCOUNTING OFFICE ~- DAY Benjamin is still wearing the USD sweatshirt. Duncan pass Stops.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Benjie?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Hey Bro.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? Benjamin produces a manila envelope.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: You need to look at this. I found a deposit slip. It didn’t make sense. So I opened this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit across the table. Duncan holds a formerly-sealed manila envelope in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: You never opened this package?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: No. I mean, no.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Bro.  63.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I couldn’t open an envelope that said, “open in case of death.”

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: (shakes his head, off deposit slip) You are the Michael Jordan of Denial. The... Moses of Avoidance.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Can we not talk about it?

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: No -- talk about it. Look at this. Do you realize what this woman did for you? She knew exactly what you'd do. She knew you’d make some bad investment, try to run away, and need a cushion. She had your cushion ready. $44,000. She calls it your circus money. This woman is still looking out after you. Well, this part is unfortunate, she says, “Listen to your heart, not your brother.”

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: She liked you. She just liked me more.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Well. I can see why you still burn the torch, man.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: It’s been six months. I’ve gotten to the other side. Duncan decides not to bust him.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: You're free. You realize that.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: You know you've got to give up the zoo. It’s undoable, Benjie. This money is your ticket out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan looks at his watch. 4:02.  64. Lily shows up. He’s grown used to her visits.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Hey Dylan.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Here -—~ She gives him a sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: I hear you may not be staying here much longer.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I mean, it’s expensive and... I hear there’s some money stuff. Dylan instinctively brightens.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: We're going home? Wow! Lily wilts at his excitement over leaving. He doesn’t not her disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but if you still want to be friends, I‘11 still be your friend. I mean, you know, there’s cars and all.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Of course. Are you for real with this? She nods quietly. DYLAN (CONT’D) This is fantastic! Her face falls further.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Hey, listen, I gotta go. Don’t tell anybody what I heard, okay?  65.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Sure. Hey, take care... you don’t have to... uh, leave so fast. He has no idea he’s hurt her so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin returns. He passes Lily’s Message-Sign in the Jaguar window. It reads: FOOD HAS NOT ARRIVED DUE TO RAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin exits the car. Robin meets him immediately.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: You‘ve been summoned to the Jaguar.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I heard, the food delivery.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: No. Rhonda the Secretary is leaving for a job in Mexico. She’‘s turned everybody against you. She gays you have no money. She says you’re a fraud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Inquisition. Everybody is here, and staring at Benjamin with yearning eyes. Benjamin takes a look at his notepad, and then puts away. He decides to speak from his heart. And here he fin his own voice... with people.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Well. I want to say that it has been an amazing experience here. And each one of you, I’ve come to know in some small way -~-

dialogues.speaker: SHOTS OF THEIR FACES
dialogues.text: Preparing for the news. Arms crossed. Each one powerfully invested in his every word. BENJAMIN (CONT‘D) But the financial climate being what it is, I think no one thought this was... I don’t know how to say this... but... (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BENJAMIN (CONT’D I‘ve been an adventure addict my whole life, without a big regard for cost, basically I was just an observer, and a writer. But this is my first rea] adventure...

dialogues.speaker: SHOTS OF THEIR FACES
dialogues.text: Where's this going?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I just want to say that... this has been the best one of all because it’s personal. And thanks to my wife Katherine, the money came in -~ so I don’t know what you've heard. But I am able to say... though I don’t have a lot, I have enough toe get us by. And if you stick with me, I will give this everything, but I will need everything from you, and we are going to re-open this zoo. It’s the best job in the world but it will take everything to make it work.

dialogues.speaker: THEIR FACES
dialogues.text: Shocked. Rhonda had told them all he was going to bail ou

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Well, that’s good enough for me. They all clap... except for Rhonda.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: And I wish you well in Mexico, Rhonda. Adios.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music. The level of these zookeepers’ game has been raise if possible, even higher. There is new inspiration. Ellis continues expanding Buster’s enclosure. Kelly hauls meat in a bucket. Robin replaces the fencing. Benjamin does business in his home office. He looks at a bill Robin has just delivered.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Eight hundred dollars for a sewage drain in the bear enclosure?  67.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Buster is a big bear, Benjamin. He generates... PROPELS, really... an enormous amount of waste... the girth alone... Benjamin consults his list.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: {interrupting) Okay, so we’ve done all the First Priorities. Let’s do the new lighting in the tiger’s night enclosure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: bylan looks at his watch. It’s 4:15. No Lily. He’s disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his nighttime area, Spar dozes. The light flickers ove him. Benjamin works behind a protective wall, reaching ov and unscrewing the bulb.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I‘ll take care of this, buddy. Spar looks at him, blinking like he’s listening.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You like the new straw we got you? You know, alfalfa provides more insulation. I know this because ive been online, keeping up with the -- (as he unscrews) ~- wildcat insulation community where alfalfa is a very sexy topic my friend. Spar blinks. BENJAMIN (CONT’D) Alright, I have the wrong bulb here, I'll have to go to Home Depot and get you a new one. Eighteen miles, baby. I‘ve got it down to two songs, each way. He turns, sees Kelly locking at him.  68.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: You get the part where they don’t talk, right? Benjamin smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: He talks. INT. HOME DEPOT -— DAY Benjamin picks out the proper small fluorescent fixture, socket and bulb. Rosie is picking items up from the oppos aisle. Both shopping.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Nice one, Dad. You pick good bulbs.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Thanks Rosie. Anything else we need while we’re over here in the land of people?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Nope, I’m good. She sees a group of city kids, just about her age, wander by, looking prematurely mature. Benjamin hurries her alon ROSIE (CONT’D) How come you don’t tell stories anymore?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Because we‘re living the story.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: I wish we could teil Mom.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: You don‘t think she knows?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIB
dialogues.text: I know she knows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin and Rosie lean across the counter in the same fashion. The spritely CASHIER moves into shot.

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: 74 dollars and 36 cents. Benjamin shakes his head.  69. CASHIER (CONT’D) I don’t come up with the prices. Benjamin nods, of course. He hands over a much-used credi card to the Cashier, who looks at it curiously.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: It’s a little worn.

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: No, it’s just... it says Rosemoor Animal Park..

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: That’s the one.

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: You work there?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Ido. And I also own it. Strange but true.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: (loves saying it) We bought a zoo!

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: I love that place. We used to go there all the time. Is it going to open again soon? We miss that freakin‘ zoo.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: No, I’m busting your balls for fun. Of course I’m serious. Benjamin breaks into a big smile.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: We‘re close. Planning to open the beginning of this summer.

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: Well, then, we will be there. Reserve me nine tickets, we‘1ll bring my in-laws, maybe feed a couple of ‘em to the tigers.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Well, that’s... that’s just great. Thank you. Thank you very much.  70. He pumps the Cashier’s hand, very pleased, and moves on w a bounce in his step.

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: Mister, your bulbs. He returns for the bag. Excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Thank you. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin puts up the new light fixture, in good spirits.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: You want to hear something crazy? We see he’s talking to... Spar.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think we’re going to be okay, buddy. Spar seems especially lackadaisical. Benjamin looks down notices that Spar’s food sits uneaten in a corner of the enclosure.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (concerned) Come on, man, we talked about this. You gotta eat all the food to get all your meds. He leans in closer. Spar looks at him. BENJAMIN (CONT’ i) There is a major buzz waiting for you inside that meat. I’m telling you. That’s gonna jack you up. Your neurotransmitters will be sending signals to the moon and back. You’re gonna be dating 7 year olds, man. You’re gonna have housecats lined up from here to El Cajon. Spar rolls over. Bored and old. Benjamin is concerned.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Buddy. If you don’t eat the food and don’t get the meds, it can all go downhill fast, I'm telling you. Next thing you know “they” will be saying -- (imitation) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ~-- “we don’t know what else we can do for you” -- Spar makes a disinterested noise.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We've made it this far. We're almost there. You gotta stick with me, okay? You gotta. We've got opening day coming up. He turns. Sees that Kelly is at the other side of the enclosure, behind him, listening to everything. He moves past her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly follows. Benjamin anticipates the subject -~- Spar.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: He’s okay, he’s fine!

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Benjamin, that’s not what’s happening here.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: What ‘s happening is we've actually started to fix this place. We're gonna ace the next inspection, and were going to open Rosemoor on t .

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: You are hurting that animal. She is beyond passionate. This is her world. She’s . emotional. He ignores her. She rushes to catch up to him.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can fix this place up all you want, but it won’t bring Katherine back. He stops. She stops. Oops. The wrong topic and the wrong time. He turns. She’s still mortified.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: This is not about Katherine.  72.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: How would I know? You never talk about her.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: And for your information, I’ve made my peace with losing her.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Really? He pauses. She has truly, truly gone too far.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: (immediately) End of the personal stuff!

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: (just as immediate) Makes me happy. They exit in opposite directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids are asleep. Finally, Benjamin sits alone at the kitchen table. He’s wearing glasses. His laptop is in fro of him, closed. He flips it open. He opens I-Photo. Scrolls down to the file marked -- K. Each move he makes comes with deliberation. As if each step is a milestone. He highlights the file. A page of thumbnail photos comes up. He stares at it. The effect is the opposite of uplifting. Benjamin shuts the laptop but continues staring at the pl where the photos were a moment earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The microwave breakfasts are ready.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: {nothing) Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: No clue.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Thanks. Helpful.  73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thicket of peacocks with their fans up. They scatter at the noise of Benjamin on the porch, revealing Rosie.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Rosie, come on! I depend on you to be dependable!

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Dad, look. One of the peahens is calmly perched on the ground. ROSIE (CONT’D) it’s Lucy. She laid her eggs.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Great. In the middle of the driveway. It‘s going to get eaten by a wolf or a dog in three minutes flat. Rosie, we have to go.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: {upset) But you won’t let anyone eat the eggs, will you? It’s not her fault she’s not smart.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Honey, she's very smart. she picked you as her friend. But we_ must evacuate.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: If we don’t help her, then I’m not going to school.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Rosie ——

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Won’t. Go. Rosie crosses her arms, stands firm.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Look, Daddy has a _ lot going on right now. Kind of a Tsunami of «+. big-people stuff. Okay? You want me to stop everything, buy a fence and put it around some zoologically insignificant peafowl?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Yes I do.  74. They regard each other.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Good idea. You're not going to school today. Dylan has been listening in.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: You would never do that for me.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: You are not going to school today either, young man. We're going to spend this day together. We’re gonna build a fence.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: (new respect) Yes sir. Dylan locks around for Lily. Nowhere in sight. That never used to be the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They build a fence around the peahen. Music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin and Kelly check out the Tiger enclosure. They ar brisk and professional with each other. Nothing personal, all about the animals. Lily is nearby. They see that Spar has climbed onto the tallest ledge overlooking the enclos It’s a thin slab of rock, and Spar is perched on it, pant

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: He got up there and now he can’t get down.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Don’t we have an animal ladder?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: (dismissive) We've tried luring him with food but he won’t move. He’s stuck. She turns, the echoes of their fight still in the air.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Just give him a second. He‘'ll be okay.  75.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: (anguished) He needs to come down and eat, he needs that medication and he hasn’t had any water all day. Plus, he’s broiling out there. We need to get him into his enclosure -- She‘s starting to unravel. Benjamin walks to the gate of the enclosure. He arrives a the gate. He indicates he’s going inside.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Are the other two cats inside?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Benjamin -- be serious.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: If he moves to attack me, at least he'll be moving. (off her look) What? I’il run. He’s slow.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: It’s not a bullfight, Benjamin. Spar tries to move. He’s struggling. Robin arrives.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Guys. I think it’s time.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: He‘s ready. Let‘’s call the Vet. You're the owner, you have to okay it, man.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: No. They look at him. BENJAMIN (CONT’D) It doesn’t feel right.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Benjamin. It never feels right. Kelly turns suddenly, as Ellis now arrives at the enclosu

dialogues.speaker: KELLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What haven’t we thought of?  76. Lily speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Loud noises scare the big cats. Maybe we can scare him into going back in.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Hold on -—- Kelly ignores him, turns to the assembled staff.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Okay, good idea. When I give you the signal, you're all going to make as much noise as possible. It’s our only option. Yell, scream, the more hysterical the better. Spar’ll hate it, but maybe he‘1l come down. EXT. TIGER ENCLOSURE -—- DAY -- MINUTES LATER Kelly raises her arm like a conductor. And lowers it. Suddenly, they’re all YELLING, and SCREECHING at Spar. El is shouting angry epithets. Benjamin is reluctant, but jo in. Camera moves across their angry shouting faces. They truly look demented. Spar is annoyed. He raises his head. The yelling continues. Spar is upset by the din. Benjamin is yelling as loud as any of them. Spar’s tail twitches, ears flattened... and a miracle happens. He RISES to his feet and slowly, painfully, step down the rise towards his enclosure, tripping the door th shuts behind him. Instantly relieved, exhausted and red-faced, everybody st yelling. Except for one. Benjamin. He cannot stop. They stare at him. He stops. Embarrassed, he moves away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly finds Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Ben. Jamin.  77.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Look -- I’m feeling a real lack of privacy right now. Like we're all just a little bit in each other’s pockets. She ignores his personal issue.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Can’t you see his legs? Spar‘s suffering. I can’t stand the pain. I know him. He says nothing. KELLY (CONT’D) They can’t tell you. They can’t tell you. They show you. He says nothing. KELLY (CONT’D) it‘s going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I thought he was getting better. Why not let him live? She keeps repeating it, like a mantra:

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: It's going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: This isn't about Spar, this is about you. I’m more concerned about you!

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: It’s going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: You're too emotionally invested in this.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Of course Ii‘m invested! I've been with him 13 years. You know how it’s going to end. Can you see how selfish this is? You're too smart not to. She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Why not let him live a few weeks longer?  78.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: I quit. I quit. She storms off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosie sits next to Lucy, who perches on her eggs. Lucy lo at Rosie. Rosie looks at Lucy. They've been doing this fo a long time. Kelly arrives. Your dad around?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: He said he was going to think. He does that sometimes. Nearby, Dylan is on the porch, sketch-pad in hand, doing drawings of the nighttime sky.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: You making dinner?

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: (bummed ) No.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Why don’t you let me help you? I'll order some pizza.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: That’s okay. Dad‘ll be back. He’s just having a mood.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: How long do his moods last?

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: (still drawing) Couple years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They eat pizza together. Still no Benjamin. Rosie takes t plates inside.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Do you miss Lily?

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Me. No. Not too much.  79.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: I bet you put all your feelings into your drawings.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Naw. Not really. I ess I can’t talk to girls that weil.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: It’s pretty easy, Dylan. They’1l tell you everything. The secret to talking -- She leans forward. KELLY (CONT’D) -- is listening.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, she doesn’t talk to me anymore. Rosie returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From outside the window, we see Kelly herding the kids upstairs, to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly is alone now. She sits out on the porch. Leon at he feet. We hear a car door slan. Benjamin walks up the steps and sits next to her. There is an oddly comfortable silence, as if they’ve spen the entire day together. They listen to the sounds of the Zoo.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I thought when I came out here, it would stop. She looks at him. Listening.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Back home, every place reminded me of her. Filippi's on 3rd Street by the water. Neal's Coffee Shop. Balboa Park. That’s a big one. He taps her arm.  80.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The way the air smells in May and August, when her favorite bushes grew flowers all over our neighborhood. They‘re triggers, man. INT. DYLAN’S ROOM -- LATER NIGHT Dylan hears the sound of voices on the porch,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin continues. Kelly listens, afraid to even move. s loves this side of him.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I was looking at Katherine’s death certificate and I couldn’t make out a word next to my name, and then I was told it was “WIDOWER,” a new word. Now it’s a whole new thing. She was so level-headed —- she was instrumental in every financial decision. She is irreplaceable in sO Many ways. And for a while, it was better, it was. But the funny thing is, it turns out she’s here too. I go to Home Depot, or the Target-Nine-Miles-Away, seriously, I'm avoiding half the aisles. Pasta, condiments, pastries -- she loved Blueber: Pop-Tarts, well who doesn’t, but this girl could eat eight desserts and not gain a pound, or bat an eye. I turn on the radio, sad songs, happy songs, any songs, they’re all her... the other night, I picked up the list of our favorite channel numbers, her handwriting destroyed me. It used to be by our bed. It's stiil by my bed. The numbers aren't even eal . I cannot let go. And why should I? Kelly nods. This was her revelation several nights ago. S listens, and he continues. BENJAMIN (CONT’D) Coffee is no good either. I met her in a coffee shop, it’s a silly story, but I think about it all the time. The first thing she said. I sort of live by it.  81.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I don’t want to. I‘d have to use the past tense. And by the way, let’s not mention French food. Anything French, her favorite. French people, French accents, French toast, France itself, French Fries, French’s Mustard... our dishes, our books, our clock, the couch where she napped, the chair where she... stopped living. Kelly listens, still not moving. She’s alternately charme and horrified at her lack of a chance with this guy.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And most of all, the kids. Rosie, the little dance she does when she eats something she likes or -- Behind them, a light goes on, a window opens. Neither notices.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: -~ or Dylan, his eyes, I’ve only seen that shade of green on one person before. And the way he drives me nuts, makes me crazy, denies me, frustrates me, looking back at me with her green eyes and none of her lightness. She listens. BENJAMIN (CONT’D) What I figured out is that when you love someone that much, that hard, for that long, you can‘t get away from them no matter where you go. And why should you? Beat. BENJAMIN (CONT‘D) Half the time I feel like I‘m running across the Sahara, in lead shoes, with a plastic bag over my head. I can’t get a... He jokes. BENJAMIN (CONT’D) “Handle on it.”  82.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: You're scaring me.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I was the best version of me because she loved me. And now, without her, I wake up every day and think “now I gotta fool everybody into thinking I know what I'm doing for another day.” And Dylan, that little hardass -- he sees right through me. He looks at Kelly. There is power in his realization, and her listening to him. BENJAMIN (CONT’D) I cannot let qo. Beat. Kelly pats his knee. She sighs. She has no chance. He’1l belong to Katherine forever.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: i can. She smiles, bittersweetly, rises to exit. Gave it her bes Upstairs, a door SLAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin goes to check, finds Dylan defiant in the hallwa

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: I get it now, okay? I get why you ean’t stand me! Benjamin tries to herd Dylan, and the “problem” back into room. He immediately dismisses the content of Dylan’s wor and it pisses him off more.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Okay -- alright --

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: (won't budge) No! At least now I know the real reason you hate me. I heard you admit it to her. Like you were talking about corn flakes... you hate me. He catches Benjamin’s full attention.  83.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Hate you? Come on, you’re a good kid. You've made mistakes, we've made mistakes, we’re working through ‘em. I don’t blame you for anything.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: That is BULLSHIT. Admit it. You wish I wasn’t here. With my “green” eyes. I heard you!

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) You mis-heard me.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: I'm sick of it here. Can't you see?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Well, thank you for telling me that again. I’1l pack us up and we’1lil go roaming around some more. We’1l be hobos together!

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Because yo wasted our money. Some of that belonged to me.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: {raw) I thought you liked it here! I’m sorry. I’m sorry your friends don’t visit you more, myself. And I’m sorry, I thought you were friends with Lily. I thought, I thought, I thought. I thought you liked me. I thought it was a dream come true.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: It's your dream! You can’t force a dream on somebody else!

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: (just pissed) Yes I can. Because I’m your father and I’m the only one you’ve got. The line of people who really care about you in this world... ends

dialogues.speaker: . DYLAN
dialogues.text: (simply) You never ask me how I’m doing. You never even taught me to shave.  84. Dylan slams into his room.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: (so grateful for the information) You want to know how to shave? I'd love to teach you to shave... But Dylan has locked the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin sits at his desk, in the quiet. The place is cle and orderly now and somehow feels very ty. He is still paralyzed by last night’s events. The weight of this whol endeavor shows on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin watches as Duncan‘s BMW arrives. Duncan steps ou of his car. He pulls off a great pair of shades. He is a man with a mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin walks with his brother, past the tigers.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: —- so when a tiger bites you, he actually takes your pulse, through his --

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) And this stuff doesn’t creep you out? Like when a bear escapes?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: {hands in pockets) You get used to it, Duncan.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Listen, Benjie, I came out here because —- Just then there is a sudden RUSTLING. The sound of someth moving through brush. Duncan jumps, puts his hands out, karate-style, prepared combat defense. Benjamin turns to see what’s making the sound... ++. a crinkly plastic bag, tumbling its way up the path. Duncan wilts, embarrassed.  85. DUNCAN (CONT’D) Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? That was classic. I have some Ziploc bags at home that could use a good ass-kicking. DUNCAN . I never want to hear about this again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk together.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: (a pronouncement) T have arrived with an idea.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Uh oh.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Listen man. I get it. I really do. I get the whole escape thing, I get the whole spiritual thing like -- “we're all in cages man,” -- and I get the aesthetic. I like the moats. I think it’s a big, kicky thing you got into.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: But you’re insane.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Thank you. id importal L broth And more rtantly, my brother, you are wasting... thousands and of dollars out here. TI Love you, but you have a big blind spot. You like an adventure, but Katherine knew this about money. Money is like air. You don’t know how much you need it, until it’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: This is where I’m going to put the giraffes, by the way. I want to go over my five-year plan with you.  86.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: (carefully) Bro. There’‘s no five-year plan. There’s no five-week plan. You’re getting killed out here. You're getting maimed. Now. I’ve heard from the previous owner’s lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: About what ——

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: They’re willing to make you an offer to buy the place back. At pretty close to what you paid. This is... a miracle. Benjamin nods. He’s ahead of this.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: So I come in, bankrupt the place, and they can resell without the staff and the zoo.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: I wouldn't say it was the plan then... but it’s the plan now.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Duncan. You give the previous owner’s lawyer a message from me. Tell them we’re opening September 25th. Tickets are 9 dollars apiece. I‘ve got a sick Siberian Tiger to feed.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Good. I‘11 tell him you'll think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spar, the elderly tiger, is lying on the floor, eyes shut very still. Benjamin and Kelly look on.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I‘1l call the Vet in San Diego, and see if he can start a different medication --

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Benjamin --

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: -- we don‘t know. There might be something else we haven‘t tried.  87. Kelly shifts uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: You know how I feel. She looks at him a moment. Then exits. Benjamin looks at Spar, who looks back at him. The same expression. Both ta a long breath. Benjamin sits down on the concrete floor.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: What do you think, huh Spar? What do we do now, bud? They look at each other. A silent communication between t two. Volumes are spoken by this old Tiger whose body has him down. He's just... plain... tired. Spar talks, alrigh And suddenly Benjamin is aware of somebody else in the enclosure. He turns, expecting Kelly. It’s Dylan. Dylan says nothing, either. He sits down on the concrete floor, next to Benjamin. For a moment they just sit there, leaning against the wal looking at Spar, whose body rises and falls softly with h breath. This is the big cat’s final mile.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: You did your best, Dad. He knows that. Benjamin nods.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: What happened with Lily?

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I guess I didn’t listen to something she told me, or something. I liked her.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I like when you talk.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: (truthful beat) I never know what to say to you.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I’m the same way. Maybe we should just tell each other what we wished the other guy would say -~-  88.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: “I'm sor: I brought you out here to the sticks.” Benjamin nods. He turns to Dylan.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: “You're a great Dad.” Beat. They both laugh. It’s been awhile. Spar sighs contentedly. Benjamin sits quietly with his so and a very old Siberian Tiger. Three generations of men, at the crossroads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly waits outside, pacing. Benjamin and Dylan walk out the tiger enclosure. “Benjamin nods to Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: You're sure ~~

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Yeah. She nods. Proud of him. Okay. Dylan turns to Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Come on, Dad. Let’s go home. Benjamin nods. He walks back to the house, his arm around his son. Benjamin takes one last look back. A goodbye gesture. He wraps his arm around his son, tighter as they trudge up the hill. Dylan’s Theme. INT. ROSIE‘S ROOM ~~ NIGHT Benjamin puts Rosie to bed. He lies down on the bed besid her for a moment. And notices something. There's room beside Rosie now.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. What happened to —-

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: I put my stuffed animals in the closet last night.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: You did. Huh.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: They’re not real you know.  89.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Rosie. Those animals are more real than a lot of people I know. A beat. They just lie there.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: I think Mom would've really liked it here, you know that?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Think so?

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Know 50. INT. DYLAN’S ROOM -- NIGHT Dylan is asleep. Benjamin tucks him in. His attention is drawn to a piece of artwork on Dylan’s desk. It’s a beautiful, finely wrought drawing of Spar. We hear noise. Click click click...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We come upon Benjamin, glasses on, sitting at his laptop, tucked into the corner of the kitchen, click click clicki He‘s roaming through his file of photos of Katherine and family... when the four were together... one photo after another... and we see flashes of the live-action seconds before and after the photos were taken, mixed in with the stills... Katherine’s face is always obscured in what we’ seen of her in our movie... but we see it all on Benjamin face, and in his glasses. The memories, the sadness, the loss, but most of all the unutterable joy of having share life with this person. We hear Katherine’s Theme. EXT. ZOO ~-— DAY He walks through the zoo, on his cell-phone, feeling assu

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Thank him, but it’s a no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan on his porch. Writhing in pain at this conversatio  90.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Mistake.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: We‘re going to make it, Duncan. I know we will. It’s destiny.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Benjie, this is a misfire. Okay? You've mortgaged everything, spent all your cash, even Katherine’s bail-out money. If you don’t pass this inspection, don’t open on time, you’‘re done. This is all in, man. This is what they tell you never to do. You spent all your own money. You‘’re destroying yourself and your family.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: If I turn back now, I’m just another bulishitter.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: No, you’re a smart guy who examined his options.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Every success has a moment like this.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: You’ve had nothing but moments like this!

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Disc full. I’m hanging up.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: When‘s the inspection?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Three days. Duncan moans. BENJAMIN (CONT’D) Hanging up on your moan! And he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin finds Kelly. she's holding a piece of paper, sig  91.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: We can’t do all of this before the inspection. We need more help. Lots of it.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I know. It’s undoable... until we do it. He points to the middle-distance behind him. She turns, following his gaze. A small group walks up the driveway, see a couple of townies from the Jaguar, the Cashier from Home Depot, and even a few Moms and Dads from Dylan’s sch Volunteers coming to help.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I made some calls. It’s their zoo too. Kelly greets the group, gratefully.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Hey guys! Let’s get to work!

dialogues.speaker: SHOTS
dialogues.text: As everyone gets to work on the zoo. 1) Paths are being swept. 2) Screens replaced. 3) A_new drain being installed. The top is popped. Three people recoil at the smell. 4) Enclosures being cleaned. 5) Ellis installs a P.A. System. 6) Dylan pulis a wheelbarrow across frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fevered activity has sprouted in all areas of the house. Dylan passes. Benjamin catches up to him.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Dylan, come here. Need you to look at this --

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Sure --  92.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I printed this poster out, and I was wondering if you'd give it a once-over, with your artist’s eye.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: {slightly confused) Oh. Okay. Sure. Benjamin unfurls the poster. Under the banner reading Rosemoor Animal Park is... lan’s drawing of Spar. Dylan looks at it for a moment, then looks over at Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Not bad, huh?

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Where are you putting this?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Basically -- everywhere. Dylan stares at the poster, moved. Rosie comes over, wavi her arms and yelling for her dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Peahen’s eggs are being pecked at with tiny beaks. Rosie hovers nearby. They watch as the baby peacocks poke their heads out. Benjamin puts his arm around Rosie, who is enthralled, as they continue watching. There is noise, and Benjamin turn to see... Duncan's BMW, nosing up the driveway. Benjamin shakes his head as Duncan parks and exits. He calls out to him.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Get me the trang gun! My brother ean’t take “no” for an answer!

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Not why I’m here, Bro. I called Ellis, and asked if you guys needed any help. Duncan points back to his car. DUNCAN (CONT‘D) I’ve got a trunkful of Haddock from the city. 200 pounds worth. For Bruno.  93.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: (blown away) Buster. Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: No -- serious is the smell in my car. Jesus, and I thought McDonald's fries left a smell. I started questioning my entire being about twenty miles ago. Help me, Benjie. I’m about to be sick from the smell. Benjamin, amazed, feels a wave of emotion. This explosion life. Everything inching into sharper focus. Rosie sees t feelings on Benjamin's face.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Don’t turn on the tears, Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Come on, brother, we’ve got an inspection tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: (pronouncement ) And so we do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the sun sets, we see the staff, the ople from the town Benjamin, Kelly, Duncan and the kids, all hard at work. Dylan looks at his watch. 4:15. Lily drives by on a cart. His hope rises. She passes without looking his way.

dialogues.speaker: THE SUN, RISING OVER THE ZOO
dialogues.text: Solomon the Lion roars. The sound ricochets throughout th valley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just outside the Tiger enclosure, we see Benjamin nailing small plaque to the wall. He steps back and we see it features Spar’s picture, name, and the dates of his birth and... death.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Looks good, Buddy. You in your prime. You would have done the same for me.  94. Benjamin stands a moment, smiles and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s no longer the ramshackle place it once was. It’s sprawling and organized, soulfully designed and clean, wi straight posts and tidy pathways, excited Zookeepers and content animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They raise the new sign for the front of the zoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone has lined up. Benjamin, Rosie, Dylan, Kelly, Rob and, paying little attention to Dylan, the never-more- beautiful Lily. All smartly dressed. Ellis even wears a r tie and a great suit, along with his beanie. He looks strangely serene. (He’s been drinking all night.) Waiting Finally, Duncan joins them, walking over wearing the newe pair of boots we've ever seen. Benjamin notices, amused.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: (to Ellis) Did I look like that -- Ellis nods ruefully.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIS
dialogues.text: Worse.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Wow. That’s humiliating. Benjamin shakes his head, hands out a schedule to everyon

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. Make sure all your walkies are off. I don’t want to hear about any problems. I have to keep mine on, or he’1l be suspicious, but frankly, if you have a problem, I don’t wanna know about it until Walter Ferris is gone. Got it? (they do) Here we go, and here’s to us. The USDA Van pulls up the driveway. Ferris exits with pom and circumstance, and a new blue Clipboard. Music. BENJAMIN (CONT’D) Welcome back to the Rosemoor Animal Park Adventure.  95.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: It's an Adventure now?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: To be precise, Mr. Ferris... it always was. A moved look among the staffers. The Benjamin Era is on. Ferris moves to Ellis.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Hello Ellis. How are you? Ellis says nothing. Simply nods. ‘The very minimum of decency and manners. They exchange a strong handshake. Th enjoy disliking each other.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIS
dialogues.text: On my best behavior...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris and Benjamin walk through the zoo, trailed by Dyla and Rosie who watch at a distance. They pass the Monkeys.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: As you can see, most of the enclosures have been completely re- done. All the locks were replaced... They pass a cluster of peacocks. Rosie beams as Lucy nudg her baby peacocks. Ferris stops. His stomach growls loudl Several look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Are there more now?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: One of our peahens recently hatched a brood --

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: (interrupts) IT should remind you that the peafowl are not edifying from a zoological standpoint —-

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: They may just be nice-looking pigeons, but we like ‘em. They're staying. They’re our mascots. I wouldn’t care if we have to move a few into the house. Ferris makes a judgmental note in his notepad.  96. BENJAMIN (CONT’D) May I show you the expanded bear enclosure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly is putting the finishing touches on the exhibit. Sh reaches over to double-check the lock. And that’s when sh realizes, it’s stuck in the open position. Her eyes widen. She stands in front of the enclosure. Solomon is perched on his rock. He looks over, and as if sensing Kelly’s panic, and widens his eyes. Kelly covers with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Yikes. She picks up her walkie-talkie, and presses TALK.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (overly polite) Hi Ellis, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin and Ferris are leaving the bear enclosure, as he hears the walkie-talkie crackle with Kelly’s voice.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ellis, I would just love it if you could pay me a visit near Solomon’s enclosure. Ferris perks up.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Is there a problem? Benjamin scrambles for an explanation.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Sounds like love to me. (privately) You know how it happens sometimes, working closely together... Ferris narrows his eyes. He sniffs a problem.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Let's go see Solomon’s enclosure.  97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly is still standing in front of the enclosure, madly trying to jiggle the lock to fix it. A beat. Kelly hears the low rumble of a growl. She looks up, into the eyes of Solomon, now aware that Kelly is concerned.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Hello, fella. Solomon looks at her, steady. Just then Ellis comes runni at full speed down the hill towards Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh thank God. I asked you so politely I wasn’t sure you'd come.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIS
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? That’s why I came. You’re never that nice, I knew something was up. What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Lock’s broken. And the only thing we can do... oh God... Is jimmy it from the inside.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIS
dialogues.text: Alright. Okay. We’ll just get him into his nighttime holding pen.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: That would take at least a half- hour, I‘d have to go get food, it would be a whole ordeal... EXT. ZOO —— DAY Ferris and company are striding toward the Lion enclosure

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis and Kelly brainstorm, talking over each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin instinctively stops Ferris.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Do you want something to drink?  98.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: No. I don’t drink. He starts to move. Benjamin stops him again.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Not even water?

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea what they put in water? Ferris continues walking, suspicious of everything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly is leaning her whole body over the enclosure, tryin draw Solomon to her. Meanwhile over at the enclosure door Ellis, holding a hammer, takes a deep breath, and hops th fence. Kelly watches. Dear Lord. Hear my prayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stride closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis uses his hammer to try and get the lock to drop, bu it’s frozen. Bang! Bang! Bang! He hits his thumb.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIS
dialogues.text: Sheep Farts... in Aspic... Cocktails... ARGGGGHI1!! Solomon is now trotting his way. Ellis faces the animal. ELLIS (CONT’D) Hey Boy. You don’t want me. I’m pickled in Scotch and bitterness and impure thoughts. Solomon licks his chops.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So that’s your thing. Kelly stifles a scream. Ellis turns away from the beast a continues his work, fast and assured. Solomon still considers the old man as appetizer. He then yawns, and tr the other way. Ellis hops over the fence and SLAMS the door... re-aligning the lock, which pops cleanly into pla  99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris sweeps up to the front of the enclosure, Benjamin closely behind. Benjamin looks at Ellis and Kelly, slight sweaty and glowing with false nonchalance. They smile guiltily. Ferris examines both of them, very suspiciously and then back at Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Afternoon Solomon! Solomon's tail swishes on cue, as if he were in on all of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near the driveway, locking somber, Ferris fills out the l page and signs the report. Behind Benjamin, we find Kelly Robin, Ellis, Lily, Duncan, Rosie and Dylan all waiting.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: I don’t think it will be a success. He rips the sheet from his clipboard, hands it to Benjami FERRIS (CONT’D) But good luck. Benjamin studies the paper, and then... grins. He holds i up high in the air, victorious. A cheer goes up.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I want you here on opening day. Ferris looks resolute.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: I don’t fraternize, Mr. Mee. I‘m sure I‘1l get many reports. They continue cheering. Ferris’ stomach growls. He shakes his head. He just doesn’t get this place. He exits.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKY
dialogues.text: A gray cloud moves across the sunlit afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An impromptu celebration has broken out. Lily is mixing o laptop, Ellis dances, Everyone together. Duncan finds Benjamin looking out the window.  100.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: I’ve got guys plastering our posters up every place within a 20 mile radius. Benjamin nods to himself.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Also I checked and our website isn't getting enough hits. I called in some favors, we're linked to every other zoo-or—animal-site within a hundred-and-fifty miles.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I wish Katherine were here. You know? To see this.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: I wish she were here to do this.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: She was the doer. I was the dreamer. Duncan nods thoughtfully, a drink in hand. Truer words.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: I‘m going to say it one more time. I like the animals... but I love the humans.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Dunc. What if they don’t come? What if this has all been for no reason?

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: What, did somebody just come in and hit you with the “pussy” stick? Gimme a break...you came this far. (a pronouncement) Repeal your pussification this instant!

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: (enjoying Duncan) I my pussification!

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: They will be here. Come on, you’ve worked so hard. The place is great.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: It is, great, isn’t it?  101.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: When you do something for the right reasons, nothing can stop you. We hear a thundercrack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain pounds the zoo, drenching the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan is walking up the driveway with the mail. He pauses drawing on an envelope. He passes the Jaguar, and only because he pauses to adjust his wet sock inside his shoe, does he see... : LILY’S MESSAGE WINDOW And it reads: IF YOU LOVE ME, LET ME KNOW.

dialogues.speaker: PUSH IN ON DYLAN
dialogues.text: Whose heart is beating through his chest. He looks around Suddenly, the whole place... everything... feels exactly where he belongs. Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan races to her window. She sees him and SCREAMS, and then stifles it.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Hey. She pulls up her window.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Am I_ just nuts to say that I missed you like crazy a lot? A lot. She shakes her head, no. ‘Two young romantics stare at ea other. One dry, and one in the rain. Lily stifles tears.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Plus -- I wasn’t named after Bob Dylan. I was named after a dog named Dylan.  102. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Sorry about the rain. He spreads his arms. His voice cracks with adolescence, b he gets through it just fine:

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: I love it. I loved your sign. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: ON TELEVISION
dialogues.text: A drenched regional anchor wears a yellow raincoat.

dialogues.speaker: ANCHOR
dialogues.text: ~~ the precipitation tonight is just a hint of what's coming. This summer, Betsy, has been the wettest summer in 100 years. INT. BENJAMIN MEE‘S HOME -- NIGHT The sky outside is dark. Benjamin stands alone in his liv room, a silhouette watching the Weather Channel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1) Rain pounds the zoo. 2) Zoo posters on telephone poles and kiosks, drenched. 3) _The two remaining tigers hide from the downpour under enclosure overhang. 4 Benjamin, Rosie and Dylan... even Leon look out the window at the angry sky. No end in sight. 5) Ronnie the unfortunate-looking tapir shivers in the ra EXT. MEE HOUSE ROOF -~ RAINY NIGHT —- LATER Lily and Dylan are on the roof, under a window awning, ju inside the rain. Just the quiet sound of night, only rain and the sound of not~so-distant animals. They know they should be kissing. It’s awkward.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: I'd kiss you but it would be such a cliché. Lily smiles contentedly.  103. INT. OFFICE -— NIGHT Benjamin sits in his office, going over paperwork. Ellis the door.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIS
dialogues.text: You gave it everything. I just wanted you to know that.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Thanks Ellis.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIS
dialogues.text: Sorry about the rain.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Revenue comes from the summer. We picked the wrong time to open.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIS
dialogues.text: You're a success aS a person, Benjamin. Isn’t that the whole ballgame? Wasn’t that the whole purpose? You reached down deep, where it’s ugly and beautiful and you don’t always win. Benjamin nods thanks.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I appreciate you not attacking or killing Walter Ferris.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIS
dialogues.text: It has not been easy. I really, really dislike him. He shut down this zoo, and stole 500 dollars from me in the 1980's. I hate him, you know ~- Benjamin laughs to himself. It’s known.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: fry to keep a lid on it Ellis.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIS
dialogues.text: -~ but I have a soft spot for you. And I know you're just passing through, but you’re a good man to your family. You made that little giri of yours happy.  104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin's alarm clock goes off. He sits up. He doesn’t hear anything. He gets out of bed and walks to the window aB.ue INT. DYLAN’S ROOM -- MORNING Dylan flies out of bed. He runs over to the window and pu over his curtains and sees... It's a gorgeous sunny day. He lets out a happy yell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A view of the whole house and the zoo. The sky is more th clear. It’s that particular crystal clear blue that comes after a heavy rain. We see Benjamin in the window. Smilin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin is finishing getting dressed when Rosie looks in She’s picked out a special dress for the occasion. Her ha is in two utterly perfect braided pigtails. Benjamin looks at her, confused, How did that happen? The door swings open to reveal Kelly, standing beside her.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: French braids. Big in the 90’s.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: (smiles) Nice... very nice... He admires the two of them.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: They're going to be here today, Benjamin. I know it. 10 ‘o clock, this place will be packed. He gives them a look -- it’s up to fate now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone has gathered at the entrance to the zoo. Benjami cuts the tape across the entrance to cheers. He clears hi throat.  105.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Well, I tried to write a speech. If Katherine were here, she would have written something clever and witty for me and I would have read it and taken full credit. A beat. He looks at their faces. BENJAMIN (CONT‘D) It doesn't matter how the adventure ends, that’s not what an adventure is about. So I’m going to declare this an adventure to remember. Worth every penny, and anything that happens from here is a bonus. They applaud.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So Katherine, I will take full eredit. And I will quote her and it was the first thing she said to me -—

dialogues.speaker: ON BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Quick as a heart~attack, and almost as powerful... he’s h by a completely unexpected freight train of emotion. It‘s everything he’s been holding back. He finds he cannot finish. He lowers his head, and looks up, speechless. Ellis bails him out.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIS
dialogues.text: Let's see who's here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk tentatively down the pathway to the front of th zoo. When they get there, what they find... «+. 18 no one.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: (off watch) One minute after the last time you asked. 9:59.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: They should be here. There should be a line. Right here.  106.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Patience, my son.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: No. He's right. They should be here. Benjamin takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Maybe it’1l take awhile. Maybe this is how it's supposed to be.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: I don’t believe that. I don’t. Something's wrong. And Dylan starts running down the drive.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Dylan! Come back! He doesn’t. Benjamin follows.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: I know something's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Dylan -- Dylan disappears around the corner, to the side driveway. Benjamin follows, and sees... lan standing in front of a giant tree, almost four feet high, lying across the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Must have gotten knocked over in the storm -—- And now Dylan has his Dad‘s fervor too.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: -- let‘s fix it. They work together, as everyone now catches up to them.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Rob get the chainsaw in the garage.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: I‘1l be back in a minute. Rob runs back to get the saw.  107.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: They couldn‘t have gotten through even if they were here -—- Benjamin throws a leg over the downed trunk, and climbs u it. When he straightens, he can see across the hillside below. We watch his face. Shocked. Barely able to process what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Benjamin, what's wrong? She runs over and scrambles up onto the leg beside him. Everyone does the same, Rosie requiring a boost from Lily Kelly stands beside Benjamin. We see what he’s looking at POV BENJAMIN -— THE ROAD IN A long line of cars, waiting patiently for the zoo. Cars backed up a city block long. Music begins now, the Zoo Theme, at first tentatively. People are now starting to leave their cars parked by the side of the road, and walk up the path to get there. They’ve brought strollers. And kites. And coolers. And friends. And family. Music adds instruments... as the frames fi11 with the color of the dress, the laughter, an the energy of these happy visitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People pour into the park. From every direction now. Down the hillsides, around the bend. With strollers. Backpacks Kites. The ANIMALS can feel the excitement of the crowd. Kelly leads a tour of the big cats, who bask in the attention...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: They know we’re all here today. They’re showing off!

dialogues.speaker: NEAR THE PEACOCKS
dialogues.text: Rosie shows off her brood. Music continues, adding instruments.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: ».. this is Lucy and Wesley and Peaches, Jackpot, and Coco, and these are the babies.... The group of Visitors listen, riveted.  108. ROSIE (CONT’D) Peafowl are very resilient animals. Some have escaped from captivity and have established wild communities. However, due to the fact that there are so many peafowl, some people consider them to be a zoologically insignificant animal. She smiles. ROSIE (CONT’D) We ignore those people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Zoo is alive.

dialogues.speaker: ON ROB
dialogues.text: Who stands in his work boots and directs traffic.

dialogues.speaker: ON KELLY
dialogues.text: Standing in the human traffic, tears in her eyes. It’s so real to her, and she feels it so deeply. Music continues. EXT. BUSTER'S ENCLOSURE ——- DAY Buster enjoys his expanded world, delighting the “bear” people. (Note: We will notice in this sequence, that many people are drawn to the animals they most resemble.)

dialogues.speaker: ON OUR ZOOKEEPERS
dialogues.text: People who don’t normally hug, hugging now.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Is congratulated by strangers, every few steps.

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER
dialogues.text: Well-done. The simplicity of the compliment moves him.

dialogues.speaker: ON DYLAN
dialogues.text: He gives Lily a sandwich. She opens it. Inside is a drawing. It’s the Underworld drawing, and in the corner, sun. She laughs. He shrugs, still not sold on the sun, bu happy she’s happy. Guess that’s a relationship. In the distance we hear...  109.

dialogues.speaker: MACAW PARROT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: “Can’t get a handle on it. Can’t get a handie on it.”

dialogues.speaker: THE ZOO
dialogues.text: Alive with the sound of voice and laughter.

dialogues.speaker: P.A. SYSTEM
dialogues.text: {Ellis’ voice) Good afternoon. We invite you to visit our Jaguar Restaurant and Gift Shop complete with a Coffin and Dartboard for the kids. Several turn and look at the PA System quizzically.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN AND DYLAN
dialogues.text: Stand for a picture by Rosie. Arms around each other. The look... in their own still-finding—their-way manner... comfortable together.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: This one’s for Spar! Snap. With joy: ROSIE (CONT‘D) And mama! ! Snap.

dialogues.speaker: ON KELLY AND LILY
dialogues.text: Who regard Benjamin and Dylan, the two men in their lives with careful evaluation. Kelly is still a Pretty Tomboy, Lily looks completely different in make-up and older-girl clothes.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: If you had to choose between people er animals. Quick. How would you choose?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: (wistful) Animals.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: (lustful) People.

dialogues.speaker: ON PARROT ENCLOSURE
dialogues.text: Now out front, by the entrance. He’s very loud.  110.

dialogues.speaker: MACAW PARROT
dialogues.text: Can’t get a handle on it. Can‘t get a handle on it...

dialogues.speaker: ON WALTER FERRIS
dialogues.text: He shows up with his two kids, looking sli pty uncomfortable. Rosie takes him by the han ata brings him over to the peacocks.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIS
dialogues.text: Approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIS
dialogues.text: So are we all good?

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: We're good. You have all the accreditations. It’s filed with the state. Ellis immediately launches into him, holding him in a headlock.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIS
dialogues.text: Where is my money??? Where is the money?? It's broken up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin stands at the highest int in the zoo, from which he can survey as much as possible. Can‘t believe what he' seeing. Duncan joins him. He makes a courtly gesture, in their wheelhouse of unspoken communication -- actual did it. Benjamin repeats the gesture -- with your help.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: (can you believe it?) We bought a zoo. They laugh at the sheer beautiful absurdity. Music.

dialogues.speaker: THE ZOO
dialogues.text: Pull back to reveal the whole place, bustling under the b sky.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE KITES
dialogues.text: Flying in the air. One red one standing out. Katherine’s Theme.  111.

dialogues.speaker: ON BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: He watches that single red kite.

dialogues.speaker: ON KELLY
dialogues.text: Watching him. How many years will it take for him to get over this woman? She calculates in her mind. Three? Five? Damn it! She smiles to herself and returns to the animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A perfect Summer day in the city. Rosie and Dylan walk do the street with Benjamin. We’re back in Benjamin's old neighborhood. He leads them around a corner, going somewh specific at a clip. He arrives at... EXT. NEAL’S COFFEE SHOP -- DAY Benjamin leads them into the Coffee Shop.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: She was sitting right there.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BOOTH
dialogues.text: Sunlight falls on it. This booth has soul and warmth. It always will.

dialogues.speaker: ON BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Who turns to Rosie and Dylan. BENJAMIN (CONT’D) This is the very moment you guys both became a possibility...

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: I leve that you‘re telling us stories again.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: This is the story before the story... this is where the adventure... and you both... begin. This is where I met Katherine. That very booth. I walked up to her, on ineatinct, and I’d never done this before... And we see something miraculous...  112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATHERINE, a dark-haired soulful beauty, is looking the o way. It’s the same memory we glimpsed earlier, now come t rich and nourishing life. BENJAMIN, seventeen years ago, sweeps up to her table wit nobility he never knew he had.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: Why would an amazing person like you talk to a stranger like me? Katherine turns. It’s our first real look at her. And in her face, we can see a whole lot of Dylan. And all the sparkle and manner of Rosie. ON BENJAMIN, ROSIE AND DYLAN —~ TODAY A Threesome just looking wondrously at that booth.

dialogues.speaker: PUSH IN ON KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Who says the perfect thing, changing all their lives fore It applied then, and it has applied in every Mee Family adventure to follow. With simple elegance, she says:

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Why not? We hold on her for a moment, and then... cUT TO BLACK

dialogues.speaker: TITLES
dialogues.text: The Dartmoor Zoo in England, on which this story is based an acclaimed zoo whose methods are studied Worldwide. The Park is open to faithful followers year-round. Benjamin M and his two kids still live on the grounds. Next year, th plan to add Giraffes.

dialogues.speaker: CREDITS
dialogues.text: The Animale, with full~screen callbacks, share the credit with the Actors.
